source.a5d1295d:
# **How does the fitness factor affect the Thermal comfort of the people?**

​

**Situation**: A Real Estate in Singapore is going to develop a gym located in India considering the Personal Comfort System (PCS) to reach a higher satisfaction rate of user’s comfort.
Our team is invited to do the preliminary consultation survey on this project and provide some suggestions to reach the goals.​

**Scope**: Analyze the relationships between human factors and thermal comfort for people in India.​

**Sub-scope**: Based on research, derive the analysis for Gym Users using Body Mass Index, Fitness Levels & Metabolic Rates.

We have used the **Seaborn**, **Pandas** and **Matplot** library for this task.

Done by

**Group 9**

**GUPTA SHUBHANGI - A0231315W**

**GOKULADOSS NARAYANAN NAVEEN NARAYANAN - A0231386E**

**LIN ZIHAN - A0215726E**

**YANG JINDIAN - A0215755B**

**Acknowledgement:**

This notebook have been started with Prof.Clayton Miller's Notebook https://www.kaggle.com/claytonmiller/what-conditions-are-comfortable-for-people
![](https://image.freepik.com/free-vector/athletes-doing-fitness-exercise-gym-with-panoramic-windows-isolated-flat-vector-illustration-cartoon-people-cardio-training-weight-lifting_74855-8225.jpg)  ![](https://image.freepik.com/free-vector/runner-training-outdoors_74855-5574.jpg)  ![](https://static.vecteezy.com/system/resources/thumbnails/002/406/605/small_2x/sports-family-doing-fitness-in-gym-concept-illustration-of-people-characters-in-flat-design-vector.jpg)

source.0006a936:
# Analyzation on each age groups
 **Four sub-datasets** are created based on each age group to analyse **thermal sensation** against the **Air temprature** and **Relative Humidity** under each **fitness state**.
 
**Box plots** and **Violin plots** are used for this analyzation.
* Group1 - Elderly
* Group2 - Middleage
* Group3 - Young adult
* Group4 - Children

source.a3d3193c:
# **Segregating based on fitness**
Based on the BMI, the following function is used to segregate them into four different categories.
* Underweight = below 18.5
* fit = 18.5 - 25
* Overweight = 25 - 30
* Elderly = above 30

![FITNESS](https://www.nestle-caribbean.com/sites/g/files/pydnoa421/files/asset-library/publishingimages/nhw/bmi-about.png)
source.757ca2a6:
# **Conclusion**
After various analysis we decided to **Divide gym class into 4 based on their thermal response and comfort situation**.​
We suggested to divide our clients into four groups according to their age and Body Mass Index.
For each group,we suggested comfort temperature and humidity in accordance with the personal factors.
* For elderly underweight and fit group, the comfort temperature and humidity is 26'C and 62%, respectively.
* Similarly, 25'C and 57% for elderly overweight and for obesity group 
* 24'C and 50% for middle age 
* 25'C and 58% for young adult.

These personal comfort factors could be considered when applying the Personal Comfort System.​

![](https://png.pngtree.com/png-vector/20190307/ourlarge/pngtree-thank-you-vector-template-design-illustration-png-image_780863.jpg)
